snippet: President Ashraf Ghani of Afghanistan will meet with Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif and Pakistani military officials to discuss curbing terrorism on the shared border.
abstract: President Ashraf Ghani of Afghanistan makes his first state visit to Pakistan and will meet with Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif; there is optimism that meeting will usher in better cooperation between nations, particularly in regard to the restive border regions controlled by militants.

byline.contributor: Rod Nordland contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: President Ashraf Ghani of Afghanistan will meet with Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif and Pakistani military officials to discuss curbing terrorism on the shared border.

headline.main: Afghan President Out to Ease Relations on Visit to Pakistan
headline.print_headline: Afghan Leader, in Pakistan, Seeks to Recast Uneasy Ties
